intro: Anagallis monelli f. minoriflora, commonly known as the lesser redstem or lesser mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
